segment.source: What's new in security auditing (Windows 10)
segment.target: What's new in security auditing (Windows 10)

segment.source: Security auditing is one of the most powerful tools that you can use to maintain the integrity of your system.
segment.target: Security auditing is one of the most powerful tools that you can use to maintain the integrity of your system.

segment.source: What's new in security auditing?
segment.target: What's new in security auditing?

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: Windows 10 Mobile
segment.target: Windows 10 Mobile

segment.source: Security auditing is one of the most powerful tools that you can use to maintain the integrity of your system.
segment.target: Security auditing is one of the most powerful tools that you can use to maintain the integrity of your system.

segment.source: As part of your overall security strategy, you should determine the level of auditing that is appropriate for your environment.
segment.target: As part of your overall security strategy, you should determine the level of auditing that is appropriate for your environment.

segment.source: Auditing should identify attacks (successful or not) that pose a threat to your network, and attacks against resources that you have determined to be valuable in your risk assessment.
segment.target: Auditing should identify attacks (successful or not) that pose a threat to your network, and attacks against resources that you have determined to be valuable in your risk assessment.

segment.source: New features in Windows 10, version 1511
segment.target: New features in Windows 10, version 1511

segment.source: The WindowsSecurityAuditing and Reporting configuration service providers allow you to add security audit policies to mobile devices.
segment.target: The WindowsSecurityAuditing and Reporting configuration service providers allow you to add security audit policies to mobile devices.

segment.source: New features in Windows 10
segment.target: New features in Windows 10

segment.source: In Windows 10, security auditing has added some improvements:
segment.target: In Windows 10, security auditing has added some improvements:

segment.source: New audit subcategories
segment.target: New audit subcategories

segment.source: More info added to existing audit events
segment.target: More info added to existing audit events

segment.source: New audit subcategories
segment.target: New audit subcategories

segment.source: In Windows 10, two new audit subcategories were added to the Advanced Audit Policy Configuration to provide greater granularity in audit events:
segment.target: In Windows 10, two new audit subcategories were added to the Advanced Audit Policy Configuration to provide greater granularity in audit events:

segment.source: Audit Group Membership Found in the Logon/Logoff audit category, the Audit Group Membership subcategory allows you to audit the group membership information in a user's logon token.
segment.target: Audit Group Membership Found in the Logon/Logoff audit category, the Audit Group Membership subcategory allows you to audit the group membership information in a user's logon token.

segment.source: Events in this subcategory are generated when group memberships are enumerated or queried on the PC where the logon session was created.
segment.target: Events in this subcategory are generated when group memberships are enumerated or queried on the PC where the logon session was created.

segment.source: For an interactive logon, the security audit event is generated on the PC that the user logged on to.
segment.target: For an interactive logon, the security audit event is generated on the PC that the user logged on to.

segment.source: For a network logon, such as accessing a shared folder on the network, the security audit event is generated on the PC hosting the resource.
segment.target: For a network logon, such as accessing a shared folder on the network, the security audit event is generated on the PC hosting the resource.

segment.source: When this setting is configured, one or more security audit events are generated for each successful logon.
segment.target: When this setting is configured, one or more security audit events are generated for each successful logon.

segment.source: You must also enable the Audit Logon setting under Advanced Audit Policy ConfigurationSystem Audit PoliciesLogon/Logoff.
segment.target: You must also enable the Audit Logon setting under Advanced Audit Policy ConfigurationSystem Audit PoliciesLogon/Logoff.

segment.source: Multiple events are generated if the group membership information cannot fit in a single security audit event.
segment.target: Multiple events are generated if the group membership information cannot fit in a single security audit event.

segment.source: Audit PNP Activity Found in the Detailed Tracking category, the Audit PNP Activity subcategory allows you to audit when plug and play detects an external device.
segment.target: Audit PNP Activity Found in the Detailed Tracking category, the Audit PNP Activity subcategory allows you to audit when plug and play detects an external device.

segment.source: Only Success audits are recorded for this category.
segment.target: Only Success audits are recorded for this category.

segment.source: If you do not configure this policy setting, no audit event is generated when an external device is detected by plug and play.
segment.target: If you do not configure this policy setting, no audit event is generated when an external device is detected by plug and play.

segment.source: A PnP audit event can be used to track down changes in system hardware and will be logged on the PC where the change took place.
segment.target: A PnP audit event can be used to track down changes in system hardware and will be logged on the PC where the change took place.

segment.source: A list of hardware vendor IDs are included in the event.
segment.target: A list of hardware vendor IDs are included in the event.

segment.source: More info added to existing audit events
segment.target: More info added to existing audit events

segment.source: With Windows 10, we've added more info to existing audit events to make it easier for you to put together a full audit trail and come away with the information you need to protect your enterprise.
segment.target: With Windows 10, we've added more info to existing audit events to make it easier for you to put together a full audit trail and come away with the information you need to protect your enterprise.

segment.source: Improvements were made to the following audit events:
segment.target: Improvements were made to the following audit events:

segment.source: Changed the kernel default audit policy
segment.target: Changed the kernel default audit policy

segment.source: Added a default process SACL to LSASS.exe
segment.target: Added a default process SACL to LSASS.exe

segment.source: Added new fields in the logon event
segment.target: Added new fields in the logon event

segment.source: Added new fields in the process creation event
segment.target: Added new fields in the process creation event

segment.source: Added new Security Account Manager events
segment.target: Added new Security Account Manager events

segment.source: Added new BCD events
segment.target: Added new BCD events

segment.source: Added new PNP events
segment.target: Added new PNP events

segment.source: Changed the kernel default audit policy
segment.target: Changed the kernel default audit policy

segment.source: In previous releases, the kernel depended on the Local Security Authority (LSA) to retrieve info in some of its events.
segment.target: In previous releases, the kernel depended on the Local Security Authority (LSA) to retrieve info in some of its events.

segment.source: In Windows 10, the process creation events audit policy is automatically enabled until an actual audit policy is received from LSA.
segment.target: In Windows 10, the process creation events audit policy is automatically enabled until an actual audit policy is received from LSA.

segment.source: This results in better auditing of services that may start before LSA starts.
segment.target: This results in better auditing of services that may start before LSA starts.

segment.source: Added a default process SACL to LSASS.exe
segment.target: Added a default process SACL to LSASS.exe

segment.source: In Windows 10, a default process SACL was added to LSASS.exe to log processes attempting to access LSASS.exe.
segment.target: In Windows 10, a default process SACL was added to LSASS.exe to log processes attempting to access LSASS.exe.

segment.source: The SACL is L"S:(AU;SAFA;0x0010;;;WD)".
segment.target: The SACL is L"S:(AU;SAFA;0x0010;;;WD)".

segment.source: You can enable this under Advanced Audit Policy ConfigurationObject AccessAudit Kernel Object.
segment.target: You can enable this under Advanced Audit Policy ConfigurationObject AccessAudit Kernel Object.

segment.source: This can help identify attacks that steal credentials from the memory of a process.
segment.target: This can help identify attacks that steal credentials from the memory of a process.

segment.source: New fields in the logon event
segment.target: New fields in the logon event

segment.source: The logon event ID 4624 has been updated to include more verbose information to make them easier to analyze.
segment.target: The logon event ID 4624 has been updated to include more verbose information to make them easier to analyze.

segment.source: The following fields have been added to event 4624:
segment.target: The following fields have been added to event 4624:

segment.source: MachineLogon String: yes or no If the account that logged into the PC is a computer account, this field will be yes.
segment.target: MachineLogon String: yes or no If the account that logged into the PC is a computer account, this field will be yes.

segment.source: Otherwise, the field is no.
segment.target: Otherwise, the field is no.

segment.source: ElevatedToken String: yes or no If the account that logged into the PC is an administrative logon, this field will be yes.
segment.target: ElevatedToken String: yes or no If the account that logged into the PC is an administrative logon, this field will be yes.

segment.source: Otherwise, the field is no.
segment.target: Otherwise, the field is no.

segment.source: Additionally, if this is part of a split token, the linked login ID (LSAPLOGONSESSION) will also be shown.
segment.target: Additionally, if this is part of a split token, the linked login ID (LSAPLOGONSESSION) will also be shown.

segment.source: TargetOutboundUserName String TargetOutboundUserDomain String The username and domain of the identity that was created by the LogonUser method for outbound traffic.
segment.target: TargetOutboundUserName String TargetOutboundUserDomain String The username and domain of the identity that was created by the LogonUser method for outbound traffic.

segment.source: VirtualAccount String: yes or no If the account that logged into the PC is a virtual account, this field will be yes.
segment.target: VirtualAccount String: yes or no If the account that logged into the PC is a virtual account, this field will be yes.

segment.source: Otherwise, the field is no.
segment.target: Otherwise, the field is no.

segment.source: GroupMembership String A list of all of the groups in the user's token.
segment.target: GroupMembership String A list of all of the groups in the user's token.

segment.source: RestrictedAdminMode String: yes or no If the user logs into the PC in restricted admin mode with Remote Desktop, this field will be yes.
segment.target: RestrictedAdminMode String: yes or no If the user logs into the PC in restricted admin mode with Remote Desktop, this field will be yes.

segment.source: For more info on restricted admin mode, see Restricted Admin mode for RDP.
segment.target: For more info on restricted admin mode, see Restricted Admin mode for RDP.

segment.source: New fields in the process creation event
segment.target: New fields in the process creation event

segment.source: The logon event ID 4688 has been updated to include more verbose information to make them easier to analyze.
segment.target: The logon event ID 4688 has been updated to include more verbose information to make them easier to analyze.

segment.source: The following fields have been added to event 4688:
segment.target: The following fields have been added to event 4688:

segment.source: TargetUserSid String The SID of the target principal.
segment.target: TargetUserSid String The SID of the target principal.

segment.source: TargetUserName String The account name of the target user.
segment.target: TargetUserName String The account name of the target user.

segment.source: TargetDomainName String The domain of the target user..
segment.target: TargetDomainName String The domain of the target user..

segment.source: TargetLogonId String The logon ID of the target user.
segment.target: TargetLogonId String The logon ID of the target user.

segment.source: ParentProcessName String The name of the creator process.
segment.target: ParentProcessName String The name of the creator process.

segment.source: ParentProcessId String A pointer to the actual parent process if it's different from the creator process.
segment.target: ParentProcessId String A pointer to the actual parent process if it's different from the creator process.

segment.source: New Security Account Manager events
segment.target: New Security Account Manager events

segment.source: In Windows 10, new SAM events were added to cover SAM APIs that perform read/query operations.
segment.target: In Windows 10, new SAM events were added to cover SAM APIs that perform read/query operations.

segment.source: In previous versions of Windows, only write operations were audited.
segment.target: In previous versions of Windows, only write operations were audited.

segment.source: The new events are event ID 4798 and event ID 4799.
segment.target: The new events are event ID 4798 and event ID 4799.

segment.source: The following APIs are now audited:
segment.target: The following APIs are now audited:

segment.source: SamrEnumerateGroupsInDomain
segment.target: SamrEnumerateGroupsInDomain

segment.source: SamrEnumerateUsersInDomain
segment.target: SamrEnumerateUsersInDomain

segment.source: SamrEnumerateAliasesInDomain
segment.target: SamrEnumerateAliasesInDomain

segment.target: SamrGetAliasMembership

segment.source: SamrLookupNamesInDomain
segment.target: SamrLookupNamesInDomain

segment.source: SamrLookupIdsInDomain
segment.target: SamrLookupIdsInDomain

segment.target: SamrQueryInformationUser

segment.source: SamrQueryInformationGroup
segment.target: SamrQueryInformationGroup

segment.source: SamrQueryInformationUserAlias
segment.target: SamrQueryInformationUserAlias

segment.source: SamrGetMembersInGroup
segment.target: SamrGetMembersInGroup

segment.source: SamrGetMembersInAlias
segment.target: SamrGetMembersInAlias

segment.source: SamrGetUserDomainPasswordInformation
segment.target: SamrGetUserDomainPasswordInformation

segment.source: Event ID 4826 has been added to track the following changes to the Boot Configuration Database (BCD):
segment.target: Event ID 4826 has been added to track the following changes to the Boot Configuration Database (BCD):

segment.source: Event ID 6416 has been added to track when an external device is detected through Plug and Play.
segment.target: Event ID 6416 has been added to track when an external device is detected through Plug and Play.

segment.source: One important scenario is if an external device that contains malware is inserted into a high-value machine that doesn’t expect this type of action, such as a domain controller.
segment.target: One important scenario is if an external device that contains malware is inserted into a high-value machine that doesn’t expect this type of action, such as a domain controller.

segment.source: Learn how to manage your security audit policies within your organization.
segment.target: Learn how to manage your security audit policies within your organization.
